bibl.title: Letter from James Carroll to James Evelyn Pilcher, November 26, 1901

div1.p: Carroll thanks Pilcher for mentoring him early in his career.

div1.head: Letter from James Carroll to James Evelyn Pilcher, November 26, 1901
div1.opener:
(COPY.)
910 23rd St., N.W., Washington.
Nov.26,1901.
My dear Dr. Pilcher:-
div1.p:
Your kind and cordial letter
of the 9th was duly received and I can assure
you it at once recalled the generous assistance
yo gave me years ago, as my preceptor in medicine
during my early struggles for a man's palce in
the world. I am still in the field and working.
I teach in medical school four nights in the
week and do the pathological work in one of the
city hospitals besides (through the kindness of
General Sternberg, who secured the appointment
for me several years ago) ................
.............................................
................... With kindest regards, and
hoping to have the pleasure of seeing you during
the coming summer,
div1.closer:
Sincerely and gratefully yours, (signed)
JAMES CARROLL.
